title: Refraction - beam in semicircular blocks and pt Q

content.question: The figure shows a top view of two semicircular, transparent blocks of equal size, Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, that have been placed in contact with each other. Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> has an index of refraction <math alttext="n sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> has an index of refraction <math alttext="n sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>. A laser beam is directed into Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and is incident on the interface between the blocks at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, the common center of the two blocks. At Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, the incident beam makes an angle <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> from the normal to the interface and is refracted into Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, where it makes an angle <math alttext="theta sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> with the normal. Point <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> is at a location that the beam would intersect if the blocks were not present. Which of the following actions could result in the beam intersecting Point <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>?

choices.label: Making the angle of incidence at point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> greater than <math alttext="theta sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

Replacing Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> with an identically-sized block that has an index of refraction greater than <math alttext="n sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>n</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

Replacing Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> with an identically-sized block in which light travels slower than it does in Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
Swapping the positions of blocks <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>

content.answer: Replacing Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> with an identically-sized block in which light travels slower than it does in Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>
